verses.kjv: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.
verses.ct: Then I noticed that the one sitting on the throne held a scroll in his right hand, written on both the front and the back, sealed with 7 seals.

verses.kjv: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose the seals thereof?
verses.ct: I also saw a powerful angel calling out in a loud voice, "Who is worthy to open the scroll and break its seals?"

verses.kjv: And no man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the book, neither to look thereon.
verses.ct: But no one in heaven, on the earth, or beneath the earth was able to open the scroll or even look inside it.

verses.kjv: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.
verses.ct: I cried deeply because no one could be found who was worthy to open the scroll, read it, or even look inside it.

verses.kjv: And one of the elders saith unto me, Weep not: behold, the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose the seven seals thereof.
verses.ct: Then one of the elders told me, "Stop crying! Look — the Lion from the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed. He is able to open the scroll and break its 7 seals."

verses.kjv: And I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.
verses.ct: Then I looked, and there in the center, surrounded by the throne, the 4 living creatures, and the elders, stood a Lamb that appeared to have been slaughtered. It had 7 horns and 7 eyes, which are the 7 Spirits of God sent out across the entire earth.

verses.kjv: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.
verses.ct: The Lamb stepped forward and took the scroll from the right hand of the one sitting on the throne.

verses.kjv: And when he had taken the book, the four beasts and four and twenty elders fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps, and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.
verses.ct: When he took the scroll, the 4 living creatures and the 24 elders dropped to the ground before the Lamb. Each of them held a harp and golden bowls filled with incense, which represent the prayers of God's people.

verses.kjv: And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;
verses.ct: They sang a new song: "You are worthy to take the scroll and open its seals, because you were slaughtered, and with your blood you purchased people for God from every family, language, people group, and nation.

verses.kjv: And hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.
verses.ct: You have made them a kingdom and priests to serve our God, and they will rule on the earth."

verses.kjv: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders: and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands;
verses.ct: Then I looked and heard the voices of countless angels surrounding the throne, the living creatures, and the elders. Their number was 100,000,000 and thousands upon thousands.

verses.kjv: Saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing.
verses.ct: They declared in a loud voice, "The Lamb who was slaughtered is worthy to receive power, riches, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and blessing!"

verses.kjv: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.
verses.ct: Then I heard every creature in heaven, on the earth, beneath the earth, and in the sea — everything in all these places — saying, "Blessing, honor, glory, and power belong to the one sitting on the throne and to the Lamb forever and ever!"

verses.kjv: And the four beasts said, Amen. And the four and twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever.
verses.ct: The 4 living creatures responded, "Amen!" And the 24 elders fell down and worshiped the one who lives forever and ever.
